intro: Calyptronoma robusta, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, often found on trees in its natural habitat. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Calyptronoma robusta is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
